result.execSummary:
The defendant Tanisha D Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Restitution is set at 0.
No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent or court has approved contact.

Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
Successfully complete Anger Management, and continued programming.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes: Stayed pending a review on 11-13-2015 at 1:15 pm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tanisha D Scott

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tanisha D Scott in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.  Defendant requesting the no contact order to be lifted. Court will grant request IF approved by the agent.

Defendant Tanisha D Scott in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS to count 1, court orders counts dismissed and read in for sentencing.
AS to count 2, court orders USE OF A DANGEROUS WEAPON enhancer deleted.
AS to count 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  
Sentencing proceeded.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by parties.
Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
*
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 11-13-2015 at 1:15pm.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete Anger Management, and continued programming.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent or court has approved contact.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Restitution is set at 0.
Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction she may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 38.

Defendant Tanisha D Scott in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case passed upon the request of defense counsel.  Due to branch 4 in trial, Court ordered case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 38 on 8-17-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.  mld

Defendant Tanisha D Scott in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-15-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Antonial W., AWW (5-12-2002) or AWW (3-3-2005), no possession of dangerous weapoins or firearms and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.  mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Tanisha D Scott in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Evan K Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Scheduling Conference held off the record.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Case is adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-28-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Antonial W; AWW ( 5/12/2002 ); AWW ( 3/3/2005).
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tanisha D Scott in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  
Defendant Tanisha D Scott in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
